DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Maximum Dose Administered to Planning Target Volume Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number value of the maximum dose of radiation given to the planned target volume.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Maximum Dose Planning Target Volume Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The largest possible quantity or degree._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Maximum Dose Planning Target Volume Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

A geometrical concept defined to select appropriate beam arrangements, taking into consideration the net effect of all possible geometrical variations, in order to ensure that the prescribed dose is actually absorbed in the clinical target volume.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 5 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON
